channel.title: Argf on warrick.io
channel.description: Recent content in Argf on warrick.io

item.title: python equivalent to argf or diamond operator
item.description: Ruby has ARGF and Perl has the diamond operator, but what convenience object or operator does Python provide for reading from files provided on the command line or stdin? import fileinput for line in fileinput.input(): process(line) http://docs.python.org/2/library/fileinput.html

item.title: shuffle lines
item.description: Using Ruby’s special stream, ARGF, shuffling the lines in a file is trivial: $ cat foo.txt | ruby -e "puts ARGF.readlines.collect.shuffle rescue Errno::EPIPE"
